channel.title: Community Newsletter Archive – UC Berkeley ATDP

item.title: Instructor spotlights and more: Our Community Newsletter kicks off applications for 2021
item.dc:creator: Sam Pierce
item.description: If you didn't receive it in your email inbox, check out our latest Community Newsletter, featuring SD instructor Jay Chugh and introducing Nicole Lockwood as our new teacher for Tropical Rainforests!

item.title: Who Made the Decision to Attend ATDP?
item.dc:creator: hila
item.description: What student decision-making means for grades, effort level, and enjoyment of the program Have you ever wondered what ATDP does with the end-of-summer surveys? We use the data for several purposes. Primarily, participants’ responses inform us about students’ satisfaction with their courses and instructors. They also help us learn how we can improve the program for […]

item.title: Looking Back and Ahead: Mark your 2015 calendars!
item.dc:creator: Sam Pierce

item.title: Share, Speak, Volunteer: Be a Part of the ATDP Story
item.dc:creator: Sam Pierce
item.description: Our Spring Community Newsletter contains many opportunities for students and their families to give back to the program by sharing their ATDP experiences, or making new ones! Learn about ATDP's Case for Support, the Secondary Division TA program, and more.

item.title: Community Newsletter Vol. 3
item.dc:creator: Nina Hersch Gabelko
item.description: Everyone at ATDP Is Here to Learn Students, Instructional Associates, Expert Teachers, Doctoral Students and Professors At ATDP, we grow academic talent; we don’t mine for it. This includes everyone affiliated with the program. Our group begins with novice scientists aged 5 and extends upward to Secondary Division, to ATDP teachers, to doctoral students, professors, […]

item.title: Community Newsletter Vol. 1, I. 2
item.dc:creator: Nina Hersch Gabelko
item.description: Welcome to the ATDP Family E-Newsletter Dear ATDP students, parents, alumni, and friends, Welcome to our Summer 2009 e-newsletter. Regardless of whether you are joining us for the first time or are returning to ATDP for the twelfth time, as are a few students, this issue offers new insights into our learning community and useful […]

item.title: Community Newsletter Vol. 1, I. 1
item.dc:creator: Nina Hersch Gabelko
item.description: Dear ATDP students, parents, alumni, and friends, At ATDP we think of ourselves as a family. The program orientations held before each Division begins its session are our family reunions. But right about now, there isn’t any reason why we can’t get together (virtually) one more time before we start talking about 2009. The newsletter […]
